item.title: Innophos Addresses Mismanagement of Hazardous Waste at Louisiana Facility Under Settlement Agreement
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: Port of New Orleans Among Winners of EPA Cleanup-Planning Grant
item.description: DALLAS – (Jan. 5, 2017) The Port of New Orleans is among 19 recipients of up to $200,000 each from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to plan for cleanup and reuse of brownfield sites as part of the Brownfields Area-Wide Planning (AWP) program.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: Lafayette, La., Project Wins EPA’s Smart City Air Challenge Award
item.description: DALLAS (Dec. 15, 2016) – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has selected a Lafayette, Louisiana, project as one of only two nationwide awardees of the Smart City Air Challenge.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Grant Will Help Groundwork New Orleans Build Resilient Communities
item.description: DALLAS – (Dec. 8, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency’s (EPA) Gulf of Mexico Program recently announced that Groundwork New Orleans, Inc., received a $29,995 cooperative agreement for a project to help communities build resiliency through clean energy.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Grant of More than $275,000 Will Help Louisiana Dept. of Wildlife and Fisheries Restore Coasts
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Grant of $300,000 Will Help St. Tammany Parish, La., Improve Water Quality
item.description: DALLAS – (Dec. 8, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency’s (EPA) Gulf of Mexico Program recently announced that the St. Tammany Parish, La., government received a $300,000 cooperative agreement for a project to improve water quality in the Abita River watershed.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Proposes to Redesignate Baton Rouge, La., as Attaining Ozone Standard
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Provides over $14.6M in Financial Assistance to Protect Louisiana’s Waters
item.description: DALLAS – (Oct. 24, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) recently awarded the Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality a grant of more than $14.6 million to fund clean-water projects in the state.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: New Orleans Non-profit Receives $60,000 to Restore Area Urban Waters
item.description: DALLAS – (Oct. 11, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is awarding $60,000 to the Lake Pontchartrain Basin Foundation to help protect and restore urban waters in the New Orleans area. The grant will also support community revitalization and other local priorities.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Awards up to $120,000 to south Louisiana Non-profit
item.description: DALLAS – (Oct 6, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and Mary Queen of Viet Nam Community Development Corporation are addressing environmental justice issues in south Louisiana through a competitive cooperative agreement.
item.dc:creator: Region 06
